channel.title: Internet speed test

item.title: Internet speed test
item.dc:creator: @Dr_Blunt Dr_Blunt
item.description:
@Dr_Blunt wrote:

Hi… I haven’t been around for quite awhile… And I haven’t been around SCAR for even longer

So, I’ll make this a short story.

I’ve been using my blackberry as a modem for my laptop. And yesterday I got a wild hair up my ass and decided to bridge the connection over to the LAN port on my laptop so I could play me some 360 at my girlfriends house(no internet there… pfft.). Now, I’m super lazy and I don’t like to do too much, and it’s just kind of a pain in the ass sitting there connecting/disconnecting from the internet until a decent server is found… So I have a script for reconnecting/disconnecting, but the problem is the speed tester that I found(I think on sourceforge) only checks the AVERAGE speed, and I want to find the highest speed it hit. Not sure how to do that one, My guess is with the ReadConnectionData.

Well this is what I have…

function speedtest : double;
var
html,url : string;
starttime,endtime,difference,speed : integer;
begin
  starttime := GetSystemTime;
  url := 'http://sixhoej.net/speedtest/1024kb.txt';
  html := GetPage(url);
  endtime := GetSystemTime;
  difference := Round((endtime - starttime) / 1000);
  speed := Round(1024/difference);
  Result := speed/128;
end;

Shorter story: the above determines AVERAGE speed, I would like to know the fastest download speed it has achieved, any help on this one? (FYI: it returns speed in megabit/s)

Thanks

-Dr Blunt

Read full topic
